title: Translate Existential Negation and Double Negation
instruction: Translate these sentences focusing on མིན/མེད (existential negation) and double negation from Prajnaparamita literature.

questions.transliteration: stong pa nyid la gzugs med tshor ba med 'du shes med
questions.correctAnswer: In emptiness there is no form, no feeling, no perception.

questions.transliteration: chos rnams bden pa min rdzun pa yang min
questions.correctAnswer: Phenomena are not true. Nor are they false.

breakdown.subject: ཆོས་རྣམས (phenomena)
breakdown.negation1: བདེན་པ་མིན (are not true — མིན negates identity)
breakdown.negation2: རྫུན་པ་ཡང་མིན (nor false — double negation, neither true nor false)

questions.transliteration: stong pa nyid gzugs las gzhan ma yin
questions.correctAnswer: Emptiness is not other than form.

breakdown.subject: སྟོང་པ་ཉིད (emptiness)
breakdown.negation: མ་ཡིན (is not — formal negative of ཡིན)

correctFeedback: Excellent! You understand how མིན/མེད and double negation work in Buddhist philosophical texts.
incorrectFeedback: Review: མེད means 'does not exist' (negates ཡོད), མིན/མ་ཡིན means 'is not' (negates ཡིན). Double negation (neither X nor not-X) points to the Middle Way.
